original_data.Title: AI Product Management Specialization
original_data.Short Intro: Manage the Design & Development of ML Products. Understand how machine learning works and when and how it can be applied to solve problems.  Learn to apply the data science process and best practices to lead machine learning projects,  and how to develop human-centered AI products which ensure privacy and ethical standards.
original_data.Skills: Data Science, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics, Modeling, Artificial Neural Network, Project Management, Privacy, Design Thinking, Ethics,

original_data.Title: Machine Learning for Trading
original_data.Short Intro: Offered at Georgia Tech as CS 7646
original_data.Prequisites: Students should have strong coding skills and some familiarity with equity markets. No finance or machine learning experience is assumed.Note that this course serves students focusing on computer science, as well as students in other majors such as industrial systems engineering, management, or math who have different experiences. All types of students are welcome!The ML topics might be "review" for CS students, while finance parts will be review for finance students. However, even if you have experience in these topics, you will find that we consider them in a different way than you might have seen before, in particular with an eye towards implementation for trading.Programming will primarily be in Python. We will make heavy use of numerical computing libraries like NumPy and Pandas.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Manipulating Financial Data in PythonComputational InvestingMachine Learning Algorithms for Trading

unified_data.title: Machine Learning for Trading
unified_data.description: Offered at Georgia Tech as CS 7646
skills: Manipulating Financial Data in PythonComputational InvestingMachine Learning Algorithms for Trading
prerequisites: Students should have strong coding skills and some familiarity with equity markets
No finance or machine learning experience is assumed
Note that this course serves students focusing on computer science, as well as students in other majors such as industrial systems engineering, management, or math who have different experiences
All types of students are welcome
The ML topics might be "review" for CS students, while finance parts will be review for finance students

However, even if you have experience in these topics, you will find that we consider them in a different way than you might have seen before, in particular with an eye towards implementation for trading
Programming will primarily be in Python
We will make heavy use of numerical computing libraries like NumPy and Pandas
See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity
learning_outcomes: Manipulating Financial Data in PythonComputational InvestingMachine Learning Algorithms for Trading

original_data.Title: Core ML: Machine Learning for iOS
original_data.Short Intro: Use Apple's Core ML Framework in Your iOS Apps
original_data.Prequisites: To get the most out of this course, you should have prior experience developing apps for iOS.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
